translation.value: Sim, eu quero sair da fase
Sim, eu quero sair do jogo
Sim, eu quero deletar os dados deste jogo.
Sim, eu quero carregar um jogo previamente salvo.
Rodar a Câmera para a Esquerda
Rodar a Câmera para a Direita
Volume da Voz da Matrona Sombria
Limite de FPS quando o jogo não está em foco
Teclado: Velocidade de Rolagem do mapa
Teclado: Velocidade de Rotação do mapa
Teclado: Rotação ao Redor de Eixo da Mão
Mouse: ao Redor de Eixo da Mão
Rolagem de Mapa pela Borda da Tela
Velocidade de Rolagem do Mapa pela Borda da Tela
Possesão de Objeto: Sensibilidade de Rotação
Possesão de Objeto: Inverter Eixo X do Mouse
Limitar Área de Movimentação do Cursor (Disponível Somente em Modo Janela )
Abrir o Menu quando o Jogo não está em Foco
Mostrar Barra de Vida Completa das Criaturas
Esta é uma criatura inimiga. Detalhes são desconhecidos
Sua criatura está com sono. Garanta que há Camas suficientes disponíveis.
Sua criatura está com fome. Garanta que há Comida suficiente no Bar.
Sua criatura está com sede. Garanta que há Cerveja suficiente no Bar.
Lembre de fornecar camas vazias onde suas criaturas podem descansar e recuperar pontos de vida.
Esta é uma construção inimiga. Detalhes são desconhecidos.
Você pode obter o líquido ou construir uma ponte sobre o mesmo.
Não é possível obter líquidos aqui.
Clique no líquido para ordernar que Imps o obtenham.
Construa uma mina ou cave nesta área para obter minerais
Reinforce walls to make it harder for enemies to dig through them.
Sells a building. You will only get some of the building materials back.
Opens a menu with wall constructions to build.
Opens a menu with floor constructions to build.
Opens a menu with nature objects to build.
Opens a menu with minerals to add.
Opens a menu with minerals to remove.
Opens a menu with creatures to add.
Link or unlink rooms to change their delivery paths.
Manually activates or deactivates a building.
Opens a menu with rooms to build.
Opens a menu with Bar Room constructions.
Opens a menu with Bedroom constructions.
Opens a menu with Cookery Room constructions.
Opens a menu with catacombs room constructions.
Opens a menu with farm room constructions.
Opens a menu with metalworks room constructions.
Opens a menu with prison room constructions.
Opens a menu with storage room constructions.
Opens a menu with training room constructions.
Opens a menu with trading room constructions.
Opens a menu with spells to cast.
Opens a menu with actions to perform on liquids.
Order your Imps to drop a Water Block on a tile.
Order your Imps to drop a Lava Block on a tile.
Fetch a Water or Lava Block to place in storage.
Builds a road to connect your rooms, and increase your creatures' travel speed.
Upgrade a road to increase your creatures' travel speed.
Shows details about the selected creature.
Shows details about the selected room.
Opens a menu with hydraulics to build.
Opens a menu with hydraulic switches to build.
Opens a menu with hydraulic traps to build.
Lists items that can be found naturally in the dungeon, and don't need to be created in a production chain.
Lists items that can only be produced by combining other items in a production chain.
Lists items that can be consumed by creatures.
Lists equipable weapons and other items that can be crafted and used for inflicting damage on enemies.
Lists equipable armor and other items that can be crafted and used for defending against enemy attacks.
Lists available trades that can be made in exchange for gold.
Lists buildings that can be built on different types of liquids.
Trading will take place between trading rooms and claimed portals. The more portals owned, the more trading options will be available.
Click the (+/-) button to set the trading condition.
Left-click to zoom in on active trades.
This trade is locked! Unlock trade routes by claiming additional portals to the surface world.
If more than %s2 units of %s1 are stored, then start selling %s1 for gold.
If less than %s2 units of %s1 are stored, then start buying %s1 for gold.
No trading conditions have been set for %s1.
Let slip the bulls of war!
Conquer all the human-spawning portals in the dungeon.
Catch a fish by building a bridge out to a school of fish.
Unlock and build all room types.
Make a trade with another colony.
Level up an Impanzee to learn the creature skill Barrel Roll.
Level up a Cyclotaur to learn the creature skill Bull Rush.
Level up a Piggeh to learn the creature skill Butchering.
Level up a Fishman to learn the creature skill Frog Tongue.
Level up a Knight to learn the creature skill Hurricane.
Level up a Rogue to learn the creature skill Steal.
Level up an Orc to learn the creature skill Stunning Block.
Level up an Imp to learn the creature skill Teleport.

Left-clicking on this icon will give you the option to place a creature flag that all creature of this type will rally to. This flag has a higher priority than the Rally Flag, but it has a lower priority than the Squad Flag.
Click below to add or remove crafting orders.
Not craftable without a 'Forge and Anvil'!
(Click the upper bar to switch quick-item)
Shows what race this creature belongs to.
Shows the level of this creature and how much experience is needed before the creature reaches the next level.
Shows the efficiency this creature currently has. A low efficiency will lower the creature's damage, defense, and resistance. The efficiency is affected if the creature's needs are satisfied.
Shows the damage this creature can do per second. The value shown is the attack speed multiplied with the damage.
Shows the defense this creature currently has. A high defense will help the creature withstand physical attacks.
Shows the resistance this creature currently has. A high resistance will help the creature withstand elemental attacks.
Shows the health this creature currently has. If the health reaches zero they will become unconscious. If they don't get to a bed they will die.
Shows how well-rested this creature currently is. If rest value gets too low, the creature's efficiency will be affected. If this is not addressed, they will turn against you.

Shows how full the creature is. If the creature gets too hungry, the creature's efficiency will be affected. If they don't get food, eventually they will turn against you. Feeding the creature its favorite food will increase the creature's efficiency.
This creature doesn't have any favorite food.
Shows how drunk this creature currently is. If the creature starts sobering up, the creature's efficiency will be affected. Keeping them sober too long will make them turn against you.
Shows what the creature is currently doing.
I hope you liked playing Dwelvers.
If you want to support the development of this game, and want to
be able to play the full version you can visit www.dwelvers.com
Dwelvers is a game that is being continuously updated. By pre-ordering the game, you will receive all
future updates and help us reach our goal to make Dwelvers the game it deserves to be!
This room does not need workers.
This area is unexplored. Its details are unknown.
Click on a creature to feed it to the Dark Mother:
Click on the quickicon to make a swap.
Here you see the Dark Mother's health. If it drops below zero you will loose the game!
Destroying human buildings on the surface world will feed the Evilmeter.
This shows the average health of all your creatures.
This shows the average mood of all your creatures which is based on the fulfillment of thier needs.
This shows how much storage you have available.
This shows your average productivity in the dungeon.
The time left until the next enemy wave descends through the portals.
Shows how many creatures of this type are idle.
Shows how many creatures of this type are resting.
Shows how many creatures of this type are working.
Shows how many creatures of this type are fighting.
Shows how many creatures of this type are unconscious.
Shows how many creatures of this type are angry.
Shows how many creatures of this type are unhappy.
Shows how many creatures of this type are happy.
Shows the percentage of spawning requirements that have been meet.
Items left to produce in the %s1: %s2/%s3
Place to rally all creatures that can fight to the flag
Place to rally all creature of this type to the flag.
Place to rally the squad to the flag.
Feed enemies to the Dark Mother.
Room assignment priority level for creatures. This is based on how many creatures are involved in this task at the moment.
The priority level for creatures to train. This is based on how many creatures are involved in this task at the moment.

The priority level for creatures to sleep. They will always want to sleep when they are tired. But beware, setting a lower priority can result in higher priority tasks being done first if they are available even when the creature is unhappy due to lack of sleep. This priority level is not affected by how many others are doing the same task.
The priority level for creatures to dig. This is based on how many creatures are involved in this task at the moment.
The priority level for creatures to build and transport items to the building site. This is based on how many creatures are building at the moment.
The priority level for creatures to claim new territory. This is based on how many creatures are involved in this task at the moment.
The priority level for creatures to store items that are lying around outside the rooms. This is based on how many creatures are involved in this task at the moment.
The priority level for creatures to fetch water from wells. This is based on how many creatures are involved in this task at the moment.
The priority level for creatures to fish. This is based on how many creatures are involved in this task at the moment.
The priority level for creatures to transport wounded allies. This is based on how many creatures are involved in this task at the moment.
The priority level for creatures to imprison enemies. This is based on how many creatures are involved in this task at the moment.
Feed Enemies to the Dark Mother
The priority level for creatures to feed enemies to the Dark Mother. This level is not affected by how many others are doing the same task.

The priority level for creatures to eat and drink. They will always want to eat or drink whenever they are hungry or sober. But beware, setting a lower priority level can result in higher priority tasks being done first if they are available even when the creature is unhappy due to starvation or low alcohol level. This priority level is not affected by how many others are doing the same task.
The priority level for creatures to maintain traps. This is based on how many creatures are involved in this task at the moment.
The priority level for creatures to equip new weapons and armor. This is based on how many creatures are involved in this task at the moment.
The priority level for creatures to do miscellaneous tasks that are not listed above. This option will only be available in the early access version of the game.
The priority level for creatures to reinforce walls. This is based on how many creatures are involved in this task at the moment.
The priority level for creatures to gather at the rally flag. This level is not affected by how many others are doing the same task.
Your steel ingot production is getting slow. To produce steel ingot you need coal and iron delivered to the steel smelter.
Your flour production is getting slow. To produce flour you need to grind antroots. Check your antroot production in the farmland.

Your antroot production is getting slow. The antroots in your farmland need water to grow so make sure that you have a well nearby that your workers can fetch water from. Depending on the size of your farm, you may need more than one.
Your beer production is getting slow. To brew beer you need water and antroots delivered to the brewing vat.
Your bread production is getting slow. To bake bread you need water and flour delivered to the baking table, and have wood available to get the oven burning.
Your barbecue production is getting slow. To barbecue you need fish or mice, and wood to be delivered to the barbecue.

This twisted root vegetable can be grown and harvested in the farmland in the farm room. It is perfect for underground farming as it only requires water, and doesn't need any sunlight. It can be used to brew beer or make flour for bread.
A standard barbarian axe made from steel and wood. It is heavy to wield, but has high damage.
A standard barbarian shield made from steel, wood, and bone. It is very heavy despite its small size, and those who are able to wield it enjoy its high block chance.
A standard barbarian sword made from steel and wood. While lighter than the axe, it has lower damage due to its poor quality.
Brewed in the cookery room, this sweet beer is made from water and antroot. Have your Imps serve the beer in the bar to raise the alcohol level of your dungeon drunks and make them happy.
A twisted sword that delivers unexpected attacks against even the most experienced of foes.
A piece of bone obtainable from enemies and butchered animals. It is mainly used as a crafting material.
This bone armor is made out of bone and rope, and can resist strong attacks. It is favored for use in battle as its appearance strikes fear into the hearts of enemies.
This bone axe is made out of bone and rope. Its weak damage is proof that bones should not be used for weapon making.

A simple dish for many, but down here in the darkness it is a delicacy. This bread is produced at a baking table in the cookery room using flour and water. Serve it at the bar to still the hunger of your minions so they may continue to work and do your bidding.
Ammunition for your cannon traps. Highly effective weapons when aimed at the right target!
Once a useful tool for butchering animals, now a weapon with a similar purpose against our enemies.
A lump of fossilized carbon that is used primary in the metalworks room as fuel. This mineral is easy to find as it can be mined out of every layer in the dungeon.

It's no surprise your Fishmen are extremely adept at catching fish as long as they have something sturdy to stand on. Build a bridge out to a school of fish and the Fishmen will dive in and catch a fish. Barbecue it and serve it in the bar to still your minions' hunger.
This flour is ground from antroots in the mill in the farm room. Use it to bake bread in the cookery room.

A dense, malleable, and ductile metal with an attractive bright yellow color and luster that is maintained without tarnishing in air or water. To find gold you will need to dig deep and take advantage of the natural cliff formations in the dungeon.
A simple hide armor that provides light protection. Can be worn by almost all creatures.

Along with coal, iron is one of the most common elements found in the dungeon. It is rarely seen at the surface, but is not hiding too far below. As it is contaminated by dirt and rock, it must be purified in the iron smelter in the metalworks room before use.
An armor made out of steel, rope, and leather. It has a high defense but is very heavy. Only the strongest creatures are able to wear it and take advantage of its benefits.
A simple fist weapon made out of steel and wood that delivers devastating punches to enemies.
Made out of iron and coal in the iron smelter at the metalworks room. It has been cast into a suitable shape for further processing, and is mostly used as a crafting material for weapons.
This mighty two-handed weapon is primarily crafted for human Knights, and used to keep the threat of the underworld at bay.
A piece of leather gathered from dead animals and creatures.
A simple leather armor that brings some protection against enemy attacks. Can be worn by almost any creature.
A live mouse that can be used in the farm mill wheel.
A tool used by peasants for harvesting the land. Can also be used as weapon if nothing better comes along.
Crispy. Serve it at the bar to still your minions' hunger.
A very dead mouse. Serve it at the bar to still your minions' hunger.

The underworld contains plenty of rock. In fact, you should keep a close eye on your storage capacity as you start digging out your underground lair. Use your excess rock supply to build decorations or sell it on the market.
Rope made of strong fibers gathered when chopping roots. It is mainly used as a crafting material.
Despite its simple appearance, a very dangerous weapon in the hands of an agitated wielder. It is made out of wood, rope, and steel.
Deep underneath the bedrock lie vast lakes of groundwater. Build wells in your dungeon for endless supplies of cool, fresh water for all your farming and manufacturing needs.

Not many thought that it would be possible to harvest wood in a dungeon. As it turns out, great trees are growing on the surface and their roots stretch far down through the dungeon cracks. Order your minions to harvest the roots to obtain invaluable wood to build useful constructions in your dungeon.
This wooden club is a stick with a rock on it. A primitive yet effective killing tool.
A simple wooden shield which gives the wearer some block chance. It is very cheap to produce, but can save a life.
Digs deep into the ground to build its nests near the bedrock.
A mythical creature with the strength of a bull and the depth perception of a cyclops.
An excellent spelunker who gathers minerals for their kingdom above.
Half man, half fish (and probably has half a brain). A sneaky creature that fears nothing.
A little green tireless creature that keeps your dungeon in working order.
A territorial mutant, believed to be part Imp and part Chimpanzee.
A human frontline warrior, known for their stamina and devastating sweeping attacks.
A fierce warrior whose bloodlust is matched by their drive to work metal, and cleave through rock with their pickaxe.
The peasants spend their days out on the fields gathering food for the kingdom.
A strong creature with a passion for cooking (and eating).
A greedy little creature with a knack for haggling. Just don't turn your back on them...
Tucks and rolls to nearest enemy stunning it briefly.
Charge like a bull through enemy crowds. Tear their limbs apart and don't stop until something solid has been hit.
Employs inherent butchering skills to strike down enemies at close range.
Attaches a long sticky tongue on the enemy and pull him back to the caster.
Swirl a two-handed weapon around hitting all enemies that come too close.
Gives the creature swift fingers making him able to steal the enemy's equipment.
Enemies that get blocked also get stunned.
As long as nothing is being carried one can enter the forth dimension and instantly disappear from one place and appear in another.
The Dark Mother works as the headquarters for your dungeon. New minions are spawned here.
A portal that connects the surface world to the dungeon.
A continuous source of fresh water.
A place for your creatures to eat and drink.
Your minions sleep here to regain health and energy.
A road that enables faster transportation. It can be upgraded 2 times.
A reinforced wall that takes a long time to dig through.
A room where food and drinks are made.
Here is where the farming takes place.
A resting place for the dead.
Concentrate your defense by building Guard Rooms.
Remnants of a room that has been taken over by Impanzees.
A standard seamless floor used in mazes to confuse intruders.
A solid maze wall that can not be dug through.
A room for all kinds of metal construction.
Needed to keep your enemies in place.
A solid rock wall that can not be dug through.
A tribute to the vigorous Impanzees.
A tribute to the fierce Orcs.
Items stored here will be claimed as yours.
Used for trading goods with other colonies.
Prepare your minions for future battles.
A bridge with an arc-shaped appearance.
A cozy fireplace designed for the bedroom.
All chests are filled with items and treasure that your Imps can claim.
A baking table used for making bread.
Used for barbecuing fish and delicious mouse meat.
Wall barrels to decorate the cookery room.
An ordinary wall torch that lights up your dungeon.
This wooden door will slightly delay an invasion and protect your dungeon so that you can rally your defenses.
Farmland used for growing and harvesting antroot.
Can be cooked and served once caught.
Produces weapons and armor using iron and other resources.
A gate that leads into the graveyard.
A barrel used for storage in the Dark Mother room.
When it gets enough pressure, it will fire a flaming cannonball in the direction it's facing.
Every time pressure reaches the counter, it will switch on or off to control the pressure.
Gives off a gigantic explosion that destroys nearby walls and foes (or unfortunate minions) when receiving pressure.
Gives pressure in one direction unless it gets pressure from another.
Excellent for trapping enemies and killing them off.
Used to transport pressure between the different hydraulic constructions.
When stepped on by an enemy, it will deliver pressure to its surroundings.
Enables pressure in only one direction. Very good for creating loops.
An switch that turns the pressure on and off.
Produces steel ingots from coal and iron ore.
Prison bars made for keeping your enemies locked in.
A floor torch made from a detached arm.
A wall torch made from a skull.
A good practice target for your melee fighters.
Produces clothing out of rope and leather.
A stone bridge that can resist lava.
A corner shelf for storing items on.
A cross table for storing items on.
A round table for storing items on.
A shelf for storing items on.
A square table for storing items on.
A wall shelf for storing items on.
A loading dock used for trading with other colonies.
An ordinary wooden bridge that keeps the creatures from falling into the water.
A ladder that enables your creatures to reach new heights.
A place for your minions to sit down for a meal and some ale.
A bed designed for Cyclotaurs only.
A bed designed for Fishmen only.
A bed designed for Imps only.
A bed designed for Impanzees only.
A bed designed for Orcs only.
A bed designed for Piggehs only.
The light flickers along the dark dungeon walls.
A patch of magical glowing mushrooms.
A war insignia to decorate the dungeon.
Build on a mineral vein to extract more minerals but during a longer timespan.
A colorful painting that can decorate one of your dungeon walls.
A pine tree that can be chopped down to obtain wood.
A solid fence designed to keep intruders at bay.
Can be chopped down to obtain wood.
An simple wall lantern that lights up your dark dungeon.
Decorate your dungeon with torture tools to show your creatures who is boss.
Ah, the countryside is awash in joy and happiness on this glorious morning bathed in sunshine and smiles.
It’s enough to make you sick!
Well now, up and at ‘em warden. Your guiding hand is needed if we are to show these blissful saps the error of their ways.
I command you to build an army to lay waste to those who stand above us, arrogant in their belief that they are the goodly, righteous, and true masters of this world.
You will only have Piggehs and Imps join your dungeon for now.
Imps are your main laborers and will do most any job in the dungeon.
Piggehs only work in the Cookery and can be called to battle although they are in no hurry to get anywhere.
The bar room should be your first construction. But first you must dig out an area to be able to place the Bar.
Great job! Now your creatures will have somewhere to sit while they are stuffing their faces.
But this only works as long as we have food, and the main ingredients for making food are made in the farm room. So get to building a farm room!
So now we have a farm land where we can grow antroots. The next step is to build a mill so that we can grind the antroots and make flour.
As you may have noticed no antroots are growing in the farm land, this is because we don't have water.
A well should be placed somewhere close to the farm land, so sell a piece of the farm room and build the well there.
Have you noticed the mouse infestation in the dungeon? Mice are a good protein source and Imps love to eat them, so construct a mouse trap and Imps will place antroot to draw them in.
Wonderful! Now you are able to produce water, antroots, flour and mice. All that's needed now is a cookery room so Piggehs can prepare the food.
Now that your creatures can fill their bellies, they'll need a place to sleep or exhausted creatures will have your head. Build them a bed room or else there will be a revolt.
I can see that your creatures can't reach the excavation area. Build a gate on the farm land so that they can pass through.
Now build three beds for each creature type. These beds are not only for sleeping, but also a place where your creatures can go to heal after battle.
Great job! Now it is finally time to build the cookery room.
To be able to start producing food and beer you best build a baking table, a barbecue, and a brewing vat.
Let's not get too pleased with ourselves. You've shown you can provide the basic needs for any dungeon, but you've yet to see combat. Let's see if you are ready to face those humans...
Dig out the flashing area by selecting it with the left mouse button.
Right-click over the area you just dug out. This will open the radial menu where you get the option to build a bar room. Build the bar room by dragging the hammer over the flashing area.
Now open the radial menu in the newly built bar room and select to build a bar table. Build it on the location that is pointed out for you.
Dig out the flashing area and build a farm room in the newly excavated area.
Open the radial menu in the farm room and select to build farm land. Build it on the location that is pointed out for you.
Now build a mill at the location that is pointed out for you.
Make Room for Building a Well
Open the radial menu and choose the sell option. Sell the farm land at the location that is pointed out for you and then build a well in its place.
Build a mouse trap at the location that is pointed out for you.
Dig out the flashing area and build a bed room in the newly excavated area.
Open the radial menu over the farm land and select to build a farm land gate. Place it in the location that is pointed out for you.
Build three Piggeh beds and three Imp beds in the newly built bedroom.
Dig out the flashing area and build a cookery room in the newly excavated area.
Build a baking table, a barbecue, and a brewing vat in the newly built cookery room.
